Recorded in Florence (1978 Cramps Music / 2006  Edel Italia Srl) 
       

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
                       Description
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Â«A five-piece band from Florence that only released an album. Their 
drummer Mauro Sarti had previously played with Campo di Marte. The LP, 
released by Cramps in 1978, included four long instrumental tracks in a 
typical jazz-rock style, with nice horn arrangements and good guitar, 
keyboards and sax solo parts. After a line-up change, and despite a good 
live activity, the band disappeared in the fertile florentine new wave 
scene of the late seventies. This one and only record by this band  is an
awesome gem within the Italian Fusion scene. Really a pity that these 
great musicians disappeared somewhere in the diaspora. There has been a 
Japanese CD release of the record later on.Â» 
Source: http://www.progarchives.com/artist.asp?id=1663
